oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mike Flight program - 1948-01-24 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First recording is a segment of Mike Flight aviation news program, featuring Louis Buck (announcer), Jud Collins (host), Colonel Roscoe Turner (guest), Colonel Herald Fox (guest), and Gerald O'Brien (guest) on January 24, 1948 on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) Second recording is a segment of Lawrence Goodman's piano moods, featuring Louis Buck (announcer) and Lawrence Goodman (host/performer) on November 29, 1953 on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lawrence Goodman
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Jud Collins talks and introduces the Mike Flight radio program -- Louis Buck talks about current events in the field of aviation -- Louis Buck talks about new G.I. flight training laws -- Louis Buck talks about airline travel -- Jud Collins talks introduces Colonel Roscoe Turner and talks about his accomplishments -- Colonel Roscoe Turner talks about the Mike Flight program and a lion that he used to fly with -- Jud Collins introduces Colonel Herald Fox and Gerald O'Brien -- Gerald O'Brien talks about flight lines in Kentucky and Tennessee -- Colonel Herald Fox talks about flight line importance and strategy -- Colonel Roscoe Turner talks about the importance of the aviation industry -- Jud Collins thanks all guests and previews next weeks program -- Closing statement (Louis Buck) -- [break] -- Louis Buck introduces Lawrence Goodman's piano moods -- Lawrence Goodman talks and introduces the first piece -- Oriental (Lawrence Goodman) [unconfirmed] -- Goodman talks and introduces the next piece -- Soaring [by Robert Schumann] (Lawrence Goodman) -- Goodman talks and introduces the next piece -- The Eagle (Lawrence Goodman) -- Goodman talks and introduces the next piece -- Prelude [by Mendelssohn] (Lawrence Goodman) -- Closing statements (Louis Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Goodman, Lawrence (Pianist); WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Collins, Jud;
